intro: Micromeria parvula, commonly known as the small-flowered cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, yellowish or greenish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by cylindrical seed pods. Micromeria parvula is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems, contributing to local biodiversity.
